Edinburgh Airport | 17,596 followers on LinkedIn. ‚úàÔ∏è| As Scotland's busiest airport, serving 14.7 million passengers in 2019, we are where Scotland meets the world.  | Edinburgh Airport is Scotland's busiest airport, handling more than 13.4 million passengers in 2017 - a record for a Scottish airport.

Flying to more than 151 destinations and on 222 routes, Edinburgh Airport Ltd directly employs over 600 people and with our partner businesses operating at campus brings the total number of employees to 7,000.

An independent economic study published in March 2016 by Biggar Economics showed that we support over 23,000 jobs across Scotland.

‚úà | We're rolling out new flight information display screens to make things easier for passengers at the airport. These screens will display more information, including potential for language translations and destination weather, and will be easier to read. They are positioned in prominent locations with large new screens around the entrance and exit to World Duty Free, along with improvements in the check-in hall and across the departure lounge. Stephanie from our IT team explains more in the video below. You can also read more about these screens, and the new features they come with, here: https://lnkd.in/ekY4f2Ge #aviation #travel #airports #edinburgh #edinburghairport #edi #passengers #IT #edimprovements

üîå| Making positive changes to our airfield vehicles. Two new EVs have joined our fleet of operations vehicles - with more planned - as we reduce emissions as part of our Greater Good sustainability strategy. This sustainability improvement is one of several improvements being rolled out across the airport this summer. It comes after two new electric coaches were introduced to our airfield, adding to the two brought in last year. üõ´ | It's been a busy first few days as an official VINCI Airports. We welcomed Nicolas Notebaert and the Executive team to Edinburgh following final confirmation of the firm's acquisition of Edinburgh Airport. They spent time with teams across the airport to explain VINCI's story and vision and where Edinburgh fits in to that, while also talking about the growth and operation at Edinburgh - it's been a great start to our VINCI future. It's also been important to discuss these future plans with our people and the media - a lot to do in just two days! By bringing together the knowledge and expertise of both VINCI Airports and Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP), two of the world‚Äôs most respected airport investors and operators, it's a significant vote of confidence in Scotland, and the future of its capital city airport. #edinburgh #edinburghairport #scotland #vinciairports #vinciconcessions #GIP #aviation #connectivity #airports
